title: Corrupted Souls
description:
by faemalenomad

A female war-weathered Harry Potter finds herself in 1943. She decides to skip the Hogwarts nonsense. She is going to get a head start on the Horcrux hunt before it happens, while trying to avoid getting caught in the war with Grindelwald. Dark!Harry, no Hogwarts, amoral but not evil

blog.name: dailypronounpractice
blog.title: Daily Pronoun Practice & Validation
blog.description:
mod: alex - nonbinary - (they/them, she/her)

trans positivity, non-binary friendly - featuring pronoun validations, positivity, and practice eg. texts with pronouns replaced (see tag #daily pronoun swap).

requests welcome

summary: today’s #dailypronounswap - Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone by JK Rowling ft. Harry + she/her pronouns got an idea for...
body:
today’s #dailypronounswap - Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone by JK Rowling ft. Harry + she/her pronouns

got an idea for dailypronounswap? requests welcome

“Up! Get up! Now!”

Harry woke with a start. Her aunt rapped on the door again.

“Up!” Aunt Petunia screeched. Harry heard her walking towards the kitchen and then the sound of the frying pan being put on the cooker. She rolled onto her back and tried to remember the dream she had been having. It had been a good one. There had been a flying motorbike in it. She had a funny feeling she’d had the same dream before.

Her aunt was back outside the door.

“Are you up yet?” she demanded.

“Nearly,” said Harry.

“Well, get a move on, I want you to look after the bacon. And don’t you dare let it burn. I want everything perfect on Duddy’s special birthday.”

Harry groaned.

“What did you say?” her aunt snapped through the door.

“Nothing, nothing…”

Dudley’s birthday - how could she have forgotten? Harry got slowly out of bed and started looking for socks. She found a pair under her bed and, after pulling a spider off one of them, put them on. Harry was used to spiders, because the cupboard under the stairs was full of them, and that was where she slept.

Harry: I'm dati...

Harry: What do you have against me dating Luna?
Ron: What? Luna? And what about Malfoy?
Harry: Why would I date Malfoy??
Ron: Because you've loved him since forever?

blog.name: ktaest
blog.title: a e s t h e t i c

blog.name: krokodile
blog.description:
If you want to know my name, pronouns, whatever, just fucking ask me.

I wrote that post before I saw Turkey in a Can. If you have an issue with the word "transvestite," tweet Loren Bouchard, as I didn't write Sheesh! Cab, Bob?

I'm a grown-ass adult from the 1980s. If you're under 18 and want me to unfollow (I don't really look to see WHO I'm following; I just see content I like and click) please do let me know and I will.

I hate the word "queer" and I will die on that hill. Call yourself whatever you want, but stop bullying people for requesting to not be referred to with that word. If you can respect every other label, you can respect that too.

Anti-kinkshaming. If your blog has a "kink blog don't interact" tag, get the fuck out and don't look back. If what you're doing is legal and consensual, I support you.

Biden and Sanders are both flaming sacks of garbage masquerading as human beings. If you're going to be a little bitch about that opinion, again, door's that way.

tags: to read makes our speaking english good
summary: it’s 90s kidlit day over here i guess.   jessica wakefield -  house: slytherin (and proud of it!) wand: alder, phoenix (aw, not...
caption:
it’s 90s kidlit day over here i guess.


jessica wakefield - 

house: slytherin (and proud of it!)

wand: alder, phoenix (aw, not unicorn??) core, 11 ¾ in, brittle

Alder is an unyielding wood, yet I have discovered that its ideal owner is not stubborn or obstinate, but often helpful, considerate and most likeable. Whereas most wand woods seek similarity in the characters of those they will best serve, alder is unusual in that it seems to desire a nature that is, if not precisely opposite to its own, then certainly of a markedly different type. When an alder wand is happily placed, it becomes a magnificent, loyal helpmate. Of all wand types, alder is best suited to non-verbal spell work, whence comes its reputation for being suitable only for the most advanced witches and wizards.

This is the rarest core type. Phoenix feathers are capable of the greatest range of magic, though they may take longer than either unicorn or dragon cores to reveal this. They show the most initiative, sometimes acting of their own accord, a quality that many witches and wizards dislike.

Phoenix feather wands are always the pickiest when it comes to potential owners, for the creature from which they are taken is one of the most independent and detached in the world. These wands are the hardest to tame and to personalise, and their allegiance is usually hard won. - garrick ollivander


patronus: erumpent (very rare) (so like technically has all the attributes of a unicorn, but ugly and ungainly?  that’s fucking brilliant.  i couldn’t write a burn that good if i tried.)

The Erumpent hurtled into fashion after a scene in the Muggle film based on Magizoologist Newt Scamander. These creatures are normally quite calm until provoked or during mating season when it will use its horn to pierce anything it deems a threat. Some wizards say that this special Patronus can use its horn to inject the Dementor with happy thoughts, making the Dementor itself explode in a burst of light. - mugglenet



elizabeth wakefield - 

house: ravenclaw (but very nearly gryffindor.  i guess ravenclaw is the most fitting, but she’s not one of the cool nice ones like luna and cho.  she’s that bitch everyone’s mad got in because she’s so uptight and keeps cleaning up everyone’s stuff that they were working on and telling them how to study “correctly.”  and she always wants to compare grades and everyone’s like ugh who CARES it’s about the learning and…liz is basically what would’ve happened if hermione had ended up in ravenclaw, is what i’m getting at.  they both probably are better suited for gryffindor.)

wand: rowan, phoenix core (identical cores!), 10 ¾ in, quite bendy

Rowan wood has always been much-favoured for wands, because it is reputed to be more protective than any other, and in my experience renders all manner of defensive charms especially strong and difficult to break. It is commonly stated that no dark witch or wizard ever owned a rowan wand, and I cannot recall a single instance where one of my own rowan wands has gone on to do evil in the world. Rowan is most happily placed with the clear-headed and the pure-hearted, but this reputation for virtue ought not to fool anyone – these wands are the equal of any, often the better, and frequently out-perform others in duels.

This is the rarest core type. Phoenix feathers are capable of the greatest range of magic, though they may take longer than either unicorn or dragon cores to reveal this. They show the most initiative, sometimes acting of their own accord, a quality that many witches and wizards dislike.

Phoenix feather wands are always the pickiest when it comes to potential owners, for the creature from which they are taken is one of the most independent and detached in the world. These wands are the hardest to tame and to personalise, and their allegiance is usually hard won. - garrick ollivander


patronus: vulture (unusual) (oh my god this generator loves the saddle club and hates the wakefields; i love this.  although i adore vultures, liz would hate this so much.  especially since it’s lobbed as an insult against reporters.)

Looming and dominant, the vulture, at its core, is a resource machine. It may seem intimidating and heartless, but in reality, it is a hyper-efficient beast that knows how to utilize even the barest of essentials. As a Patronus, it likely speaks to the caster’s willingness to get their hands dirty and do what few others are willing to perform.  - mugglenet

reblog.comment:
it’s 90s kidlit day over here i guess.


jessica wakefield - 

house: slytherin (and proud of it!)

When an alder wand is happily placed, it becomes a magnificent, loyal helpmate. Of all wand types, alder is best suited to non-verbal spell work, whence comes its reputation for being suitable only for the most advanced witches and wizards.

This is the rarest core type. Phoenix feathers are capable of the greatest range of magic, though they may take longer than either unicorn or dragon cores to reveal this. They show the most initiative, sometimes acting of their own accord, a quality that many witches and wizards dislike.

Phoenix feather wands are always the pickiest when it comes to potential owners, for the creature from which they are taken is one of the most independent and detached in the world. These wands are the hardest to tame and to personalise, and their allegiance is usually hard won. - garrick ollivander


patronus: erumpent (very rare) (so like technically has all the attributes of a unicorn, but ugly and ungainly?  that’s fucking brilliant.  i couldn’t write a burn that good if i tried.)

The Erumpent hurtled into fashion after a scene in the Muggle film based on Magizoologist Newt Scamander. These creatures are normally quite calm until provoked or during mating season when it will use its horn to pierce anything it deems a threat. Some wizards say that this special Patronus can use its horn to inject the Dementor with happy thoughts, making the Dementor itself explode in a burst of light. - mugglenet



elizabeth wakefield - 

house: ravenclaw (but very nearly gryffindor.  i guess ravenclaw is the most fitting, but she’s not one of the cool nice ones like luna and cho.  she’s that bitch everyone’s mad got in because she’s so uptight and keeps cleaning up everyone’s stuff that they were working on and telling them how to study “correctly.”  and she always wants to compare grades and everyone’s like ugh who CARES it’s about the learning and…liz is basically what would’ve happened if hermione had ended up in ravenclaw, is what i’m getting at.  they both probably are better suited for gryffindor.)

wand: rowan, phoenix core (identical cores!), 10 ¾ in, quite bendy

Rowan wood has always been much-favoured for wands, because it is reputed to be more protective than any other, and in my experience renders all manner of defensive charms especially strong and difficult to break. It is commonly stated that no dark witch or wizard ever owned a rowan wand, and I cannot recall a single instance where one of my own rowan wands has gone on to do evil in the world. Rowan is most happily placed with the clear-headed and the pure-hearted, but this reputation for virtue ought not to fool anyone – these wands are the equal of any, often the better, and frequently out-perform others in duels.

This is the rarest core type. Phoenix feathers are capable of the greatest range of magic, though they may take longer than either unicorn or dragon cores to reveal this. They show the most initiative, sometimes acting of their own accord, a quality that many witches and wizards dislike.

Phoenix feather wands are always the pickiest when it comes to potential owners, for the creature from which they are taken is one of the most independent and detached in the world. These wands are the hardest to tame and to personalise, and their allegiance is usually hard won. - garrick ollivander


patronus: vulture (unusual) (oh my god this generator loves the saddle club and hates the wakefields; i love this.  although i adore vultures, liz would hate this so much.  especially since it’s lobbed as an insult against reporters.)

Looming and dominant, the vulture, at its core, is a resource machine. It may seem intimidating and heartless, but in reality, it is a hyper-efficient beast that knows how to utilize even the barest of essentials. As a Patronus, it likely speaks to the caster’s willingness to get their hands dirty and do what few others are willing to perform.  - mugglenet

trail.content_raw:
it’s 90s kidlit day over here i guess.


jessica wakefield - 

house: slytherin (and proud of it!)

wand: alder, phoenix (aw, not unicorn??) core, 11 ¾ in, brittle

Alder is an unyielding wood, yet I have discovered that its ideal owner is not stubborn or obstinate, but often helpful, considerate and most likeable. Whereas most wand woods seek similarity in the characters of those they will best serve, alder is unusual in that it seems to desire a nature that is, if not precisely opposite to its own, then certainly of a markedly different type. When an alder wand is happily placed, it becomes a magnificent, loyal helpmate. Of all wand types, alder is best suited to non-verbal spell work, whence comes its reputation for being suitable only for the most advanced witches and wizards.

This is the rarest core type. Phoenix feathers are capable of the greatest range of magic, though they may take longer than either unicorn or dragon cores to reveal this. They show the most initiative, sometimes acting of their own accord, a quality that many witches and wizards dislike.

blog.name: rachelundefined
blog.title: RachelUndefined
blog.description:
Who am I? Can anyone really answer that question? I don't know who I am. I'm undefined.

What am I into? My biggest, but by no means only, passion is HP fanfics. My interests are many and varied, and my posts reflect my diversity.

Will our interests correspond? Only you can answer that question. Or will you, like myself, remain undefined?

summary: Harry Potter and the Order of the Light and Dark Chapter 1, a harry potter fanfic | FanFiction
title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Light and Dark Chapter 1, a harry potter fanfic | FanFiction
description:
Title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Light and Dark
Author: Priya Ashok
Fandom: Harry Potter
Ships: Harmony (Harry/Hermione); Draco/OC
Tags: Dumbledore Bashing; Severitus; powerful!Harry

Summary: COMPLETE AU after fifth year.Harry sees through Dumbledore and starts his war on both the Light and the Dark forces.

blog.name: accio-shitpost
blog.title: shitpost managed
blog.description:
FAQ

unforgivably cursing you with our existence since 1965

as seen in Bo Burnham's Eighth Grade, apparently

we have a Discord server! join here! (15+ only please)

we track the tag 'accioshitpost' (without a dash) so if you have art or a fic based on of one of our posts, pop it in there and we'll reblog it for you! we always appreciate your creativity!

you can find our amazon wishlists here and here - if you get us anything, we'll post a picture and a thank you note!!

if you want to follow our personal blogs, here's Roxie's, here's Persephone's, and here's Jamie's

nazis, terfs, pedos, and anybody happy to defend or stand by them can leave. we don't want you. avada kedavra, shithead.

now in blue raspberry flavours, hitting stores soon!

summary:
voldemort: you wouldn't kill me, potter!
harry: newsflash, asshole
harry: i've been ready to stab an eighty year old man this...
body:
voldemort: you wouldn't kill me, potter!
harry: newsflash, asshole
harry: i've been ready to stab an eighty year old man this whole time

blog.name: bitingdownpromo
blog.title: Biting Down
blog.description: The year is 2027. The wizarding community is tearing itself apart as danger lurks around every corner; the possibility of a wizarding epidemic sends the community into a frenzy that brings a new evil to power. Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance?

summary:
the electronics of your heart...
 The year is 2028. After an incendiary article from Rita Skeeter reporting an increase in...
caption:
the electronics of your heart…

The year is 2028. After an incendiary article from Rita Skeeter reporting an increase in squib births, the wizarding world is tossed into chaos concerning the loss of magical heritage. The renegades vow to protect what’s left of magical blood without caring about the damage along the way. More and more wixen go missing, including the Weasleys’ own Dominique. The Ministry fights within itself as Percy Weasley and Hermione Granger battle for the position of Minister of Magic, tearing the fabric holding wizarding society together.

see how fast they fall apart…

Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance? Whether you flee or bite down and take the heat, the next great war is coming and the outcome is up to you. Welcome to Biting Down.

home | plot | rules | wanted connections | character suggestions | application

Our roleplay currently has many canon characters available, such as Victoire Weasley, Louis Weasley, James Potter, Scorpius Malfoy, and both Scamander twins. We also welcome original characters, with lots of surnames available from canon!
